4.2 Eigenvalues and Eigenvectors 111
Theorem 4.12. The eigenvectors x1,..., xn of a matrix A∈Rn×n with n
distinct eigenvalues λ1,...,λ n are linearly independent.
This theorem states that eigenvectors of a matrix with ndistinct eigen-
values form a basis of Rn.
Deﬁnition 4.13. A square matrix A ∈Rn×n is defective if it possesses defective
fewer than nlinearly independent eigenvectors.
A non-defective matrix A ∈Rn×n does not necessarily require n dis-
